info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 10 at 10:35AM EDT until October 10 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Key West FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of the Lower and Middle Keys.
* WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rainfall associated with thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing, with freshwater flooding from rainfall being exacerbated by existing coastal flooding from seasonal King Tides. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will support continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marathon, West End Of Long Key Viaduct, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Duck Key, Conch Key, Boot Key, Knight Key and Key Colony Beach. - This includes US 1 between mile markers 9 and 63. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING
